intro: Excoecaria confertiflora, commonly known as the broadleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often toxic properties. The plant typically features large, palmately lobed leaves and produces small, clustered yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Its botanical structure includes a woody stem with persistent, alternate foliage.
